meanings.definition: A steep slope or long cliff formed by erosion or faulting.
meanings.sent1: The hikers marveled at the towering escarpments along the canyon.
meanings.sent2: The escarpments provided a breathtaking view of the valley below.
meanings.sent3: The goats played a risky game of climbing the escarpments for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as unyielding as the escarpments in the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of the escarpments in a stunning painting.

meanings.definition: A steep slope at the edge of a plateau or ridge.
meanings.sent1: We could see the distant escarpments from the top of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The escarpments marked the boundary between the two regions.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the escarpments were giant slides in their game.
meanings.sent4: The old castle stood proudly atop the rugged escarpments.
meanings.sent5: The sun cast long shadows over the escarpments as it set in the west.
